query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 O insensata cura de’ mortali, 2 quanto son difettivi silogismi 3 quei che ti fanno in basso batter l’ali!
4 Chi dietro a iura e chi ad amforismi 5 sen giva, e chi seguendo sacerdozio, 6 e chi regnar per forza o per sofismi,
7 e chi rubare e chi civil negozio, 8 chi nel diletto de la carne involto 9 s’affaticava e chi si dava a l’ozio,
10 quando, da tutte queste cose sciolto, 11 con Bëatrice m’era suso in cielo 12 cotanto glorïosamente accolto.
query.result:
**English:**
1 O senseless eagerness of mortals, 2 how defective are the syllogisms 3 that make you beat your wings downward!
4 One goes after laws and another after empty maxims, 5 and one, following the priesthood, 6 and one, ruling by force or by sophistry,
7 and one stealing and another engaged in civil business, 8 one toils, entangled in the delight of the flesh, 9 and another gives himself up to idleness,
10 when, freed from all these things, 11 with Beatrice I was welcomed up in heaven 12 so gloriously.
**Malay:**
1 Wahai kegilaan manusia, 2 betapa cacatnya silogisme-silogisme 3 yang membuatmu mengepakkan sayapmu ke bawah!
4 Ada yang mengejar hukum dan ada yang mengejar pepatah-pepatah kosong, 5 dan ada yang mengikuti imamat, 6 dan ada yang memerintah dengan kekerasan atau dengan tipu daya,
7 dan ada yang mencuri dan ada yang terlibat dalam urusan sipil, 8 ada yang bekerja keras, terjerat dalam kenikmatan daging, 9 dan ada yang menyerahkan dirinya pada kemalasan,
10 ketika, terbebas dari semua hal ini, 11 bersama Beatrice aku disambut di surga 12 dengan sangat mulia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Poi che ciascuno fu tornato ne lo 14 punto del cerchio in che avanti s’era, 15 fermossi, come a candellier candelo.
query.result:
**English:**
13 After each one had returned to the 14 point of the circle where he had been before, 15 he stopped, like a candle in a candlestick.
**Malay:**
13 Setelah masing-masing kembali ke 14 titik lingkaran tempat dia berada sebelumnya, 15 dia berhenti, seperti lilin di dalam kandil.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 E io senti’ dentro a quella lumera 17 che pria m’avea parlato, sorridendo 18 incominciar, faccendosi più mera:
19 «Così com’ io del suo raggio resplendo, 20 sì, riguardando ne la luce etterna, 21 li tuoi pensieri onde cagioni apprendo.
query.result:
**English:**
16 And I heard within that light 17 that had spoken to me before, smiling 18 begin, becoming brighter:
19 "Just as I shine with its radiance, 20 so, looking into the eternal light, 21 I learn the thoughts from which you draw conclusions.
**Malay:**
16 Dan aku mendengar di dalam cahaya itu 17 yang sebelumnya telah berbicara kepadaku, tersenyum 18 memulai, menjadi lebih terang:
19 "Sama seperti aku bersinar dengan pancarannya, 20 ya, dengan melihat ke dalam cahaya abadi, 21 aku mempelajari pikiran-pikiran yang darinya kamu menarik kesimpulan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Tu dubbi, e hai voler che si ricerna 23 in sì aperta e ’n sì distesa lingua 24 lo dicer mio, ch’al tuo sentir si sterna,
25 ove dinanzi dissi: “U’ ben s’impingua”, 26 e là u’ dissi: “Non nacque il secondo”; 27 e qui è uopo che ben si distingua.
query.result:
**English:**
22 You doubt, and you want my speech to be explained 23 in such clear and explicit language 24 that it may conform to your understanding,
25 where I said earlier: “Where one fattens well”, 26 and where I said: “No second one was born”; 27 and here it is necessary to make a fine distinction.
**Malay:**
22 Kamu ragu, dan kamu ingin ucapanku dijelaskan 23 dalam bahasa yang begitu jelas dan gamblang 24 sehingga sesuai dengan pemahamanmu,
25 di mana sebelumnya kukatakan: “Di mana orang menjadi gemuk”, 26 dan di mana kukatakan: “Tidak ada yang kedua lahir”; 27 dan di sini perlu dibedakan dengan baik.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 La provedenza, che governa il mondo 29 con quel consiglio nel quale ogne aspetto 30 creato è vinto pria che vada al fondo,
31 però che andasse ver’ lo suo diletto 32 la sposa di colui ch’ad alte grida 33 disposò lei col sangue benedetto,
34 in sé sicura e anche a lui più fida, 35 due principi ordinò in suo favore, 36 che quinci e quindi le fosser per guida.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Providence, which governs the world 29 with that counsel in which every created 30 aspect is overcome before it reaches its end,
31 so that the bride of him who with loud cries 32 betrothed her with his blessed blood 33 might go towards her beloved,
34 secure in herself and even more faithful to him, 35 ordained two princes in her favor, 36 who would be her guides on either side.
**Malay:**
28 Pemeliharaan, yang mengatur dunia 29 dengan nasihat di mana setiap ciptaan 30 diatasi sebelum mencapai akhirnya,
31 sehingga pengantin perempuan dari dia yang dengan teriakan keras 32 menikahinya dengan darahnya yang diberkati 33 dapat pergi menuju kekasihnya,
34 aman dalam dirinya sendiri dan bahkan lebih setia kepadanya, 35 menahbiskan dua pemimpin demi kebaikannya, 36 yang akan menjadi pembimbingnya di kedua sisi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 L’un fu tutto serafico in ardore; 38 l’altro per sapïenza in terra fue 39 di cherubica luce uno splendore.
query.result:
**English:**
37 One was all seraphic in ardor; 38 the other was on earth for wisdom 39 a splendor of cherubic light.
**Malay:**
37 Yang satu semuanya serafik dalam semangat; 38 yang lain di bumi untuk kebijaksanaan 39 suatu cahaya terang kerubik.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 De l’un dirò, però che d’amendue 41 si dice l’un pregiando, qual ch’om prende, 42 perch’ ad un fine fur l’opere sue.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Of one I will speak, but of both 41 it is said, praising one, whichever one takes, 42 because his works were for one end.
**Malay:**
40 Tentang yang satu akan kukatakan, tetapi tentang keduanya 41 dikatakan yang satu memuji, yang mana yang diambil, 42 karena karya-karyanya adalah untuk satu tujuan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 Intra Tupino e l’acqua che discende 44 del colle eletto dal beato Ubaldo, 45 fertile costa d’alto monte pende,
46 onde Perugia sente freddo e caldo 47 da Porta Sole; e di rietro le piange 48 per grave giogo Nocera con Gualdo.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Between Tupino and the water that descends 44 from the hill chosen by the blessed Ubaldo, 45 a fertile slope of a high mountain hangs,
46 from where Perugia feels the cold and heat 47 from Porta Sole; and behind it weeps 48 under a heavy yoke Nocera with Gualdo.
**Malay:**
43 Di antara Tupino dan air yang mengalir turun 44 dari bukit yang dipilih oleh Ubaldo yang diberkati, 45 lereng subur dari gunung yang tinggi tergantung,
46 dari mana Perugia merasakan dingin dan panas 47 dari Porta Sole; dan di belakangnya menangis 48 di bawah kuk yang berat Nocera dengan Gualdo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Di questa costa, là dov’ ella frange 50 più sua rattezza, nacque al mondo un sole, 51 come fa questo talvolta di Gange.
query.result:
**English:**
49 On this coast, there where it breaks 50 its greatest force, a sun was born into the world, 51 as this one sometimes does from the Ganges.
**Malay:**
49 Di pantai ini, di tempat yang paling deras ombaknya, 50 lahirlah ke dunia sebuah matahari, 51 seperti yang kadang-kadang terjadi di Sungai Gangga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 Però chi d’esso loco fa parole, 53 non dica Ascesi, ché direbbe corto, 54 ma Orïente, se proprio dir vuole.
query.result:
**English:**
52 But whoever speaks of that place, 53 let him not call it Ascent, for he would speak short, 54 but Orient, if he wants to speak precisely.
**Malay:**
52 Tetapi barang siapa yang berbicara tentang tempat itu, 53 janganlah menyebutnya Pendakian, karena itu akan menjadi kurang tepat, 54 tetapi Timur, jika ia ingin berbicara dengan tepat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 Ma perch’ io non proceda troppo chiuso, 74 Francesco e Povertà per questi amanti 75 prendi oramai nel mio parlar diffuso.
query.result:
**English:**
73 But so that I may not proceed too obscurely, 74 take now in my diffuse speech, Francis and Poverty as these lovers.
**Malay:**
73 Tetapi agar aku tidak berbicara terlalu samar, 74 ambillah sekarang dalam ucapanku yang panjang lebar, Fransiskus dan Kemiskinan sebagai kekasih-kekasih ini.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 Oh ignota ricchezza! oh ben ferace! 83 Scalzasi Egidio, scalzasi Silvestro 84 dietro a lo sposo, sì la sposa piace.
query.result:
**English:**
82 Oh unknown riches! Oh fertile good! 83 Egidius goes barefoot, Sylvester goes barefoot 84 behind the Bridegroom, so pleasing is the Bride.
**Malay:**
82 Wahai kekayaan yang tidak diketahui! Wahai kebaikan yang subur! 83 Egidius bertelanjang kaki, Silvester bertelanjang kaki 84 di belakang Mempelai Pria, begitu menyenangkan sang Mempelai Wanita.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Indi sen va quel padre e quel maestro 86 con la sua donna e con quella famiglia 87 che già legava l’umile capestro.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Then goes that father and that master 86 with his lady and with that family 87 that already bound the humble cord.
**Malay:**
85 Kemudian pergilah bapa dan guru itu 86 bersama istrinya dan dengan keluarga itu 87 yang telah mengikat tali yang sederhana.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 Poi che la gente poverella crebbe 95 dietro a costui, la cui mirabil vita 96 meglio in gloria del ciel si canterebbe,
97 di seconda corona redimita 98 fu per Onorio da l’Etterno Spiro 99 la santa voglia d’esto archimandrita.
query.result:
**English:**
94 After the humble people grew 95 behind him, whose wondrous life 96 would be better sung in the glory of heaven,
97 with a second crown, he was crowned 98 by Honorius, by the Eternal Spirit, 99 the holy desire of this archimandrite.
**Malay:**
94 Setelah orang-orang miskin bertambah 95 di belakangnya, yang hidupnya yang menakjubkan 96 akan lebih baik dinyanyikan dalam kemuliaan surga,
97 dengan mahkota kedua, dia dimahkotai 98 oleh Honorius, oleh Roh Abadi, 99 keinginan suci dari archimandrite ini.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 E poi che, per la sete del martiro, 101 ne la presenza del Soldan superba 102 predicò Cristo e li altri che ’l seguiro,
103 e per trovare a conversione acerba 104 troppo la gente e per non stare indarno, 105 redissi al frutto de l’italica erba,
106 nel crudo sasso intra Tevero e Arno 107 da Cristo prese l’ultimo sigillo, 108 che le sue membra due anni portarno.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And then, because of his thirst for martyrdom, 101 in the presence of the proud Sultan 102 he preached Christ and the others who followed him,
103 and because he found the people too obstinate to convert 104 and because he did not want to stay there in vain, 105 he returned to the fruit of the Italian land,
106 in the harsh rock between the Tiber and the Arno 107 he received the final seal from Christ, 108 which his body bore for two years.
**Malay:**
100 Dan kemudian, karena dahaganya akan mati syahid, 101 di hadapan Sultan yang sombong 102 ia menyebarkan agama Kristen dan orang-orang lain yang mengikutinya,
103 dan karena ia mendapati orang-orang terlalu keras kepala untuk bertobat 104 dan karena ia tidak ingin tinggal di sana dengan sia-sia, 105 ia kembali ke buah dari tanah Italia,
106 di batu yang keras antara Sungai Tiber dan Arno 107 ia menerima meterai terakhir dari Kristus, 108 yang ditanggung oleh tubuhnya selama dua tahun.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Quando a colui ch’a tanto ben sortillo 110 piacque di trarlo suso a la mercede 111 ch’el meritò nel suo farsi pusillo,
112 a’ frati suoi, sì com’ a giuste rede, 113 raccomandò la donna sua più cara, 114 e comandò che l’amassero a fede;
115 e del suo grembo l’anima preclara 116 mover si volle, tornando al suo regno, 117 e al suo corpo non volle altra bara.
query.result:
**English:**
109 When it pleased him who had drawn him to so much good 110 to draw him up to the mercy 111 that he merited by making himself humble,
112 to his friars, as to just heirs, 113 he commended his most dear lady, 114 and commanded that they should love her faithfully;
115 and from his lap the glorious soul 116 wished to depart, returning to its kingdom, 117 and for its body it wanted no other bier.
**Malay:**
109 Ketika ia yang telah menariknya kepada kebaikan yang begitu banyak 110 berkenan untuk menariknya ke atas kepada belas kasihan 111 yang telah diperolehnya dengan merendahkan dirinya,
112 kepada para biarawannya, sebagai pewaris yang adil, 113 ia menyerahkan wanita yang paling dicintainya, 114 dan memerintahkan agar mereka mencintainya dengan setia;
115 dan dari pangkuannya jiwa yang mulia itu 116 ingin pergi, kembali ke kerajaannya, 117 dan untuk tubuhnya ia tidak menginginkan keranda lainnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Ben son di quelle che temono ’l danno 131 e stringonsi al pastor; ma son sì poche, 132 che le cappe fornisce poco panno.
query.result:
**English:**
130 I am indeed among those who fear harm 131 and huddle close to the shepherd; but we are so few, 132 that the cloaks provide little cloth.
**Malay:**
130 Aku memang termasuk di antara mereka yang takut akan bahaya 131 dan merapatkan diri kepada gembala; tetapi kami sangat sedikit, 132 sehingga jubah-jubah itu menyediakan sedikit kain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 Or, se le mie parole non son fioche, 134 se la tua audïenza è stata attenta, 135 se ciò ch’è detto a la mente revoche,
136 in parte fia la tua voglia contenta, 137 perché vedrai la pianta onde si scheggia, 138 e vedra’ il corrègger che argomenta
139 “U’ ben s’impingua, se non si vaneggia”».
query.result:
**English:**
133 Now, if my words are not hollow, 134 if your hearing has been attentive, 135 if what is said recalls to your mind,
136 your desire will be partly satisfied, 137 because you will see the plant from which it splinters, 138 and you will see the correction that argues
139 “Where one grows fat, if one does not go astray”».
**Malay:**
133 Sekarang, jika kata-kataku tidak hampa, 134 jika pendengaranmu telah penuh perhatian, 135 jika apa yang dikatakan mengingatkan pikiranmu,
136 keinginanmu akan sebagian terpenuhi, 137 karena kamu akan melihat tanaman dari mana ia pecah, 138 dan kamu akan melihat koreksi yang berpendapat
139 “Di mana seseorang menjadi gemuk, jika seseorang tidak menyimpang”».
